data.title: Hong Kong's Inter-operator SMS set for 3 December launch
data.meta_description: Hong Kong's Inter-operator SMS set for 3 December launch
data.text: Hong Kong's Inter-operator SMS set for 3 December launch All six mobile operators deliver on Inter-operator SMS promise, enabling subscribers to send short messages to each other regardless of service provider HONG KONG, 23 November 2001 – All six of Hong Kong' s mobile operators announced today that their Inter-operator Short Messaging Service (IOSMS) has completed full testing and is set for launch on 3 December 2001. The new service will enable Hong Kong's mobile phone users to send short messages to each other, regardless of which service provider they use. From 3 December 2001, CSL, Hutchison Telecom, New World Mobility, PEOPLES, SmarTone and SUNDAY will provide a service that enables users to exchange short messages transparently, across their mobile networks. This project required integration between six operators’ networks and a variety of network technologies. All operators have been involved in the design, deployment and exhaustive testing of the IOSMS, which provides a robust inter-network solution and the best quality IOSMS for Hong Kong’s mobile users. The new service is powered by the Comverse SMS Gateway, which is based on Comverse’s Intelligent Short Message Service Centre (ISMSC). The Comverse portfolio of products offers fully integrated solutions based on open standards with full support for GPRS, IP connectivity, and 3G requirements. - more -
